title: The Avengers
bad_explanation: A group of coworkers with terrible communication skills have to stop a guy from using a glowing jewelry box to summon aliens through a hole in the sky.

title: Interstellar
bad_explanation: A farmer and his daughter use a magical bookshelf to solve a dust problem by sending him through a black hole to learn how to tap out Morse code in the fourth dimension.

title: The Godfather
bad_explanation: A man reluctantly takes over the family olive oil business after his dad gets some bad floral arrangements.

title: The Shawshank Redemption
bad_explanation: A man spends decades slowly redecorating his prison cell, then tunnels out through a poster to go live on a beach with his friend.

title: Avatar
bad_explanation: A paraplegic soldier gets a new blue body to live in, falls in love with a local, and then leads a tree-hugging rebellion against his old bosses.

title: Titanic
bad_explanation: A woman throws a priceless heirloom into the ocean to spite her dead boyfriend after surviving a very cold boat ride.

title: Inception
bad_explanation: A team of corporate spies use a shared nap to perform a hostile takeover inside a man's dream about his dad's feelings.

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
bad_explanation: A blacksmith and a drunk man with a magic compass team up to rescue a governor's daughter from pirates who turn into skeletons in the moonlight because they stole some cursed gold.

title: Zootopia
bad_explanation: A bunny cop and a con artist fox team up to solve the mystery of why all the city's top predators are suddenly acting like they're in a nature documentary from the 1970s.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
bad_explanation: A short man is tricked into a very long walk to throw away his ex's problematic jewelry.

title: The Dark Knight
bad_explanation: A man with a bat obsession and a clown with a love for magic tricks compete to see who can cause the most expensive traffic jam.

title: Shrek
bad_explanation: A grumpy swamp-dweller goes on a quest to rescue a princess for a short king, only to find true love is more about belches and bickering than fairy tales.

title: Dune
bad_explanation: A boy with prophetic dreams and a spice addiction leads a desert jihad against giant worms and blue-eyed aristocrats.

title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
bad_explanation: A teenager's desperate attempt to cheat on his college applications accidentally breaks the multiverse, forcing him to host a support group for older, sadder versions of himself.

title: Fight Club
bad_explanation: A depressed office worker starts a secret club where men hit each other and blow up credit card companies to impress his imaginary friend.

title: The Matrix
bad_explanation: A man discovers his entire life is a computer simulation and his only escape is to swallow a suspicious red pill and get a job in a grimy real world where he learns kung fu over the phone.

title: Parasite
bad_explanation: A poor family's elaborate plan to become live-in employees for a rich family is almost ruined by a secret basement dweller who really loves Morse code.

title: Forrest Gump
bad_explanation: A man with low intelligence accidentally becomes a millionaire and a war hero by just showing up to things and running really fast.

title: Top Gun: Maverick
bad_explanation: Aging adrenaline junkie teaches a class of hotshots how to perfectly thread a flying metal tube through a hole in a mountain to make a computer go beep.

title: Toy Story
bad_explanation: A sentient cowboy doll's existential crisis is triggered when a shiny new spaceman moves into his room and threatens his status as favorite plaything.

title: GoodFellas
bad_explanation: A man spends his entire life trying to figure out the best way to get a good table at a restaurant without waiting in line.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
bad_explanation: A boy with a forehead scar learns that the secret to eternal life is actually just a rock some old guy hid in a school.

title: Spirited Away
bad_explanation: A girl gets a smelly river spirit to vomit up a bicycle so her parents can stop being pigs.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
bad_explanation: A boy learns the true meaning of friendship when his godfather, a wanted man who turns into a big dog, tries to kill his pet rat.

title: Pulp Fiction
bad_explanation: A boxer escapes a hitman by winning a fistfight, then goes back for his father's watch because it has sentimental value.

title: Joker
bad_explanation: A failed party clown's stand-up career takes a dark turn after he discovers that dancing down stairs gets more applause than his jokes.

title: The Lion King
bad_explanation: A young prince is tricked into thinking he killed his dad by his weird uncle, runs away to live with a warthog and a meerkat, and has to go back to fight for his property after a talking monkey hits him with a stick.

title: Se7en
bad_explanation: Two detectives with wildly different decorating styles team up to stop a very literal and thematic serial killer from completing his Sunday school project.

title: Scarface
bad_explanation: A man achieves the American Dream by turning his office into a mountain of cocaine and yelling at everything until it shoots him.

title: Monsters, Inc.
bad_explanation: A city powered by children's screams is thrown into chaos when a toddler's laughter proves to be a dangerously potent energy source.

title: Your Name.
bad_explanation: Two strangers keep waking up in each other's bodies and have to coordinate a long-distance relationship and a celestial disaster prevention plan via sticky notes.

title: Finding Nemo
bad_explanation: A neurotic single dad crosses an ocean and enlists the help of a mentally unstable woman to retrieve his son from a dentist's fish tank.

title: Inglourious Basterds
bad_explanation: A group of American soldiers with a flair for arts and crafts go to France to scalp Nazis and crash a movie premiere.

title: The Green Mile
bad_explanation: A gentle giant with a urinary tract infection works miracles on death row while a sadistic guard learns that some mice are better left un-crushed.

title: Up
bad_explanation: An elderly man commits aviation crimes with a floating house to fulfill a promise to his dead wife, assisted by a bird, a dog, and a persistent child scout.

title: Back to the Future
bad_explanation: A teenager must trick his teenage parents into falling in love after his teenage mom develops a crush on him instead.

title: Alien
bad_explanation: A blue-collar crew's mandatory HR-mandated team-building dinner goes horribly wrong when an uninvited guest with acid reflux crashes the party.

title: The Batman
bad_explanation: A moody billionaire in eyeliner spends a whole night solving a crossword puzzle made by a sad clown while the city floods.

title: Oppenheimer
bad_explanation: A physicist spends three hours in a series of grey rooms arguing with other men in hats about whether he should feel bad about inventing a very large firecracker.

title: Star Wars
bad_explanation: A farm boy, a wizard, and a cowboy rescue a princess from a giant metal goth and blow up her fascist condo.

title: The Fifth Element
bad_explanation: A cab driver and a cosmic ginger team up to stop a giant space marble from destroying Earth with the power of opera.

title: The Terminator
bad_explanation: A time-traveling robot learns that the best way to prevent a future war is to fail at dating in the 1980s.

title: Iron Man
bad_explanation: A billionaire arms dealer has a midlife crisis, builds himself a high-tech pacemaker, and decides to fight his own company's products.

title: Coco
bad_explanation: A boy steals a dead rock star's guitar and has to get his great-great-grandmother's permission to go home.

title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie
bad_explanation: A mustachioed plumber from Brooklyn must save a princess from a spiky turtle by eating mushrooms and racing go-karts.

title: Shutter Island
bad_explanation: A detective goes to a spooky hospital for cops and realizes he's the main character in his own elaborate fan fiction.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
bad_explanation: A stockbroker discovers that throwing tiny people, abusing office furniture, and consuming enough drugs to tranquilize a rhino is the secret to the American Dream.

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
bad_explanation: A woman in a tracksuit wakes up from a coma and goes on a violent, international shopping spree for a very specific yellow accessory.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
bad_explanation: A teen is forced into a deadly, televised decathlon against his will because his name was submitted by a mysterious admirer.

title: Léon: The Professional
bad_explanation: A reclusive houseplant enthusiast teaches his 12-year-old neighbor the finer points of pest control while avoiding a flamboyant classical music fan.

title: The Notebook
bad_explanation: A man reads a story to a woman with memory loss, but it's just their own love story from a book he wrote, which is a pretty elaborate and narcissistic way to remind her she forgot him.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
bad_explanation: A man-child finally meets his deadbeat space dad, only to realize he's a planet-sized jerk who wants to replace him with a better sibling.

title: Inside Out
bad_explanation: A girl's brain is run by five tiny, emotionally unstable office workers who keep accidentally throwing away her personality and causing a mental traffic jam.

title: WALL·E
bad_explanation: A lonely trash compactor on a deserted Earth falls in love with a sleek new model and follows her across the galaxy, accidentally jump-starting humanity by returning a single houseplant.

title: Gladiator
bad_explanation: A Roman general gets fired, becomes a farmer, then a famous wrestler, and finally has a very dramatic family reunion in the afterlife.

title: Tangled
bad_explanation: A girl with suspiciously long hair is kidnapped by a woman who really believes in the anti-aging power of singing to plants.

title: Jaws
bad_explanation: A small-town mayor's refusal to invest in adequate coastal infrastructure leads to a tense contract dispute with a freelance aquatic contractor.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
bad_explanation: A boy must stop a giant snake from petrifying his classmates by talking to plumbing and trusting a sentient diary.

title: Django Unchained
bad_explanation: A dentist and a cowboy team up to rescue the dentist's wife from a man who really, really likes candy.

title: The Intouchables
bad_explanation: A wealthy quadriplegic hires a down-on-his-luck ex-con as his caretaker, and together they discover that the secret to a good life is driving really fast, listening to terrible music, and giving terrible art advice.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
bad_explanation: A teen finds a used textbook full of helpful doodles and old recipes while his headmaster goes on a quest to watch home movies.

title: Gone Girl
bad_explanation: A man's elaborate anniversary scavenger hunt backfires when his wife turns it into a national true-crime spectacle to frame him for her fake murder.

title: The Shining
bad_explanation: A struggling writer takes a remote winter caretaker job and quickly learns that the hotel's "bring your own bartender" policy is a real dealbreaker.

title: Blade Runner 2049
bad_explanation: A sad detective finds out he's not the main character and has to help a hologram have a baby with a horse.

title: Mad Max: Fury Road
bad_explanation: A man with daddy issues goes on a chaotic road trip to return a truckload of kidnapped supermodels to their plant-based mother.

title: The Martian
bad_explanation: A botanist gets left behind on a red planet and has to science the shit out of potatoes and disco music to survive.

title: Whiplash
bad_explanation: A young man endures psychological warfare with a man who treats a high school band rehearsal like a military tribunal over the proper speed of a drum beat.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
bad_explanation: A boy with a forehead scar and his friends play a high-stakes game of hide-and-seek in a magic castle, where the seeker is a noseless man who really wants to share a body.

title: Fury
bad_explanation: A tank crew learns that the best way to bond is to share a cramped metal box while being shot at by an entire army.

title: The Prestige
bad_explanation: Two magicians get so competitive they start cloning themselves and drowning the copies, which seems like an overreaction to a simple trick.

title: Schindler's List
bad_explanation: A factory owner learns that the best way to save his employees from a hostile takeover is to put their names on a very, very long receipt.

title: Ratatouille
bad_explanation: A rat with a passion for fine dining puppeteers a clumsy human to achieve culinary stardom in Paris.

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
bad_explanation: A moody teenager with a lightning scar on his forehead forms a secret study group because his new teacher is a government-appointed psychic torturer.

title: Big Hero 6
bad_explanation: A boy uses his dead brother's sentient balloon animal to form a revenge squad with his college friends.

title: Batman Begins
bad_explanation: A billionaire with a bat phobia fights a guy who weaponizes tap water while a mad scientist tries to microwave a city.

title: Howl's Moving Castle
bad_explanation: A young woman cursed with old age becomes a cleaning lady for a dramatic wizard with terrible housekeeping and a door that leads to four different places.

title: Deadpool
bad_explanation: A man with a face like a dropped lasagna and a mouth like a sewer grate embarks on a romantic quest for revenge and plastic surgery.

title: The Truman Show
bad_explanation: A man slowly realizes his entire life is a legally binding contract with a hidden camera in every shrub.

title: Cast Away
bad_explanation: A man's four-year struggle with poor customer service begins when a shipping company loses his last package.

title: Get Out
bad_explanation: A young man learns that meeting his girlfriend's family is a real brain-drain, in the most literal sense possible.

title: La La Land
bad_explanation: A jazz pianist and an actress fall in love while aggressively ignoring the existence of smartphones and having a musical number in traffic.

title: Die Hard
bad_explanation: A man ruins a holiday party by refusing to wear shoes and crawling through air ducts to retrieve his wife's Christmas presents from thieves.

title: The Pursuit of Happyness
bad_explanation: A man becomes a millionaire by solving a child's puzzle while homeless and carrying a large medical device everywhere.

title: Aladdin
bad_explanation: A street rat uses his one phone-a-friend wish to help a government official marry into the royal family.

title: Aliens
bad_explanation: A space trucker and her new squad of heavily armed coworkers have to work a mandatory overtime shift dealing with the world's worst pest infestation in a company housing unit.

title: Prisoners
bad_explanation: A man with a maze puzzle and a short fuse decides the best way to find his missing daughter is to kidnap and torture the town's most suspiciously quiet adult, who lives in a camper van with his aunt.

title: Nightcrawler
bad_explanation: A man learns that freelance journalism is just filming car crashes and breaking into houses, and becomes a self-help success story.

title: Knives Out
bad_explanation: A detective solves a murder by noticing that a nice old lady is way better at a board game than she should be.

title: The Incredibles
bad_explanation: A family of former celebrities is forced out of retirement when their biggest fan becomes a stalker with a killer robot.

title: The Departed
bad_explanation: A man with a terrible haircut tries to find a man with a terrible haircut, but they both work for the same terrible haircut enthusiast.

title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
bad_explanation: A fedora-wearing archaeologist really hates snakes but loves melting Nazis with a supernatural Tupperware container.

title: The Revenant
bad_explanation: A man gets really mad at a bear for ruining his camping trip and then takes a very long, cold walk to complain about it.

title: Good Will Hunting
bad_explanation: A genius janitor gets free therapy from his friends and a guy who really loves apples, then chases a girl to California.

title: Psycho
bad_explanation: A woman checks into a motel for a relaxing shower and gets into a surprise debate about proper knife storage with the innkeeper's mother.

title: Encanto
bad_explanation: A magical house falls apart because nobody in the family will go to therapy.

title: Corpse Bride
bad_explanation: A nervous groom accidentally marries a dead woman during rehearsal, and finds the afterlife has better jazz.

title: Taxi Driver
bad_explanation: A lonely man with insomnia and a mohawk tries to impress a woman by taking her to a porno theater and then decides his true calling is to assassinate a politician and rescue a child prostitute.

title: Edward Scissorhands
bad_explanation: A lonely suburban inventor's unfinished project, a pale boy with hedge-trimming appendages, becomes a surprisingly popular hairstylist before a misunderstanding ruins the topiary.

title: Arrival
bad_explanation: A linguist learns to talk to squids and discovers that time is just a confusing, non-refundable gift.

title: Hacksaw Ridge
bad_explanation: A conscientious objector wins a war by politely asking everyone to stop shooting so he can carry them down a ladder.

title: Reservoir Dogs
bad_explanation: A group of color-coded criminals argue about tipping etiquette and bleed all over a warehouse floor after a jewelry heist goes wrong.

title: Her
bad_explanation: A lonely man falls in love with his new computer's cheerful customer service representative, leading to awkward group dates and a messy digital breakup.

title: Me Before You
bad_explanation: A small-town woman's new job as a cheerful companion for a grumpy, paralyzed millionaire takes a dark turn when she realizes her real assignment is to convince him not to go through with his assisted suicide vacation.

title: The Conjuring
bad_explanation: A family moves into a fixer-upper and hires a pair of married ghost exterminators who are way too excited about their haunted doll collection.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
bad_explanation: A sentient slab of granite teaches apes to use tools, then sends a man on a very long, trippy retirement home tour through a fancy hotel room.

title: How to Train Your Dragon
bad_explanation: A scrawny teen defies his village's entire economy by making friends with the local wildlife, starting with the most dangerous dog-sized cat-bat he can find.

title: The Sixth Sense
bad_explanation: A child therapist doesn't realize he's been fired for months because all his clients are dead.

title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
bad_explanation: A boy helps a wrinkly, glowing-fingered houseplant run away from government scientists by hiding it in his closet and teaching it to use the telephone.

title: Soul
bad_explanation: A middle school music teacher dies and becomes a cosmic mentor to a soul who thinks life is just about jazz and haircuts.

title: Zack Snyder's Justice League
bad_explanation: A group of moody, superpowered individuals spend four hours trying to find three glowing boxes while a guy with a flute watches from space.

title: Saving Private Ryan
bad_explanation: A group of soldiers take a very long walk to deliver a letter to a guy who is having the worst week of his life.

title: Beauty and the Beast
bad_explanation: A woman is sentenced to house arrest in a sentient castle and falls for her furry warden after he shows her his library.

title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
bad_explanation: A short man with hairy feet and a key goes on a long walk to annoy a giant, treasure-hoarding lizard who really needs a nap.

title: Edge of Tomorrow
bad_explanation: A soldier gets so bad at his job that he has to keep dying and restarting his first day until he learns not to be terrible at alien murder.

title: Ready Player One
bad_explanation: A socially awkward gamer wins a corporate-sponsored Easter egg hunt by proving he's the world's biggest fan of 80s trivia.

title: Dead Poets Society
bad_explanation: A teacher inspires his students to rebel against their parents by standing on furniture and reading old books in a cave.

title: Mulan
bad_explanation: A girl cuts her hair, steals her dad's armor, and pretends to be a dude to win a war, all while being haunted by a tiny, opinionated dragon.

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
bad_explanation: A concierge and his lobby boy go on a chaotic, pastry-filled adventure to prove a dead old lady really did leave him a priceless painting of a boy with an apple.

title: American Beauty
bad_explanation: A suburban dad becomes obsessed with filming a plastic bag and lusting after his daughter's friend while trying to buy the coolest vintage car from his neighbor.

title: Green Book
bad_explanation: A refined pianist hires a bouncer to drive him around the segregated South so he can teach him how to eat fried chicken with his hands.

title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
bad_explanation: A street kid learns that being a gentleman involves murdering people with bulletproof umbrellas and exploding heads set to classical music.

title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
bad_explanation: A man hires a sketchy company to delete his ex from his brain, but his own memories stage a mutiny during the procedure to save the relationship.

title: Bohemian Rhapsody
bad_explanation: A man with too many teeth invents the mustache and saves music by throwing a really big party for his friends.

title: Thor: Ragnarok
bad_explanation: A space viking loses his hair, his hammer, and his planet, but gains a gladiator roommate and a sweet mixtape for the end of the world.

title: The Usual Suspects
bad_explanation: A crippled con man tells a cop a long, confusing story about a boat, a fire, and a made-up boogeyman, and then just walks away.

title: Casino Royale
bad_explanation: A man with a license to kill nearly dies because he doesn't know his own drink order.

title: Ex Machina
bad_explanation: A socially awkward billionaire pays a guy to give a Turing test to his new robot girlfriend, and it goes about as well as you'd expect.

title: The Nightmare Before Christmas
bad_explanation: A skeleton with a seasonal identity crisis tries to kidnap Santa Claus because he thinks he can do a better job, but his presents are all terrifying.

title: No Country for Old Men
bad_explanation: A man tries to return a briefcase full of money while being pursued by a man with a strange haircut and a captive bolt pistol who won't stop asking people to call a coin toss.

title: The Imitation Game
bad_explanation: A socially awkward math nerd builds a giant typewriter to win a war by listening to Germans talk to themselves.

title: Catch Me If You Can
bad_explanation: A teenager with a printer and a lot of nerve convinces the entire country he's a pilot, a doctor, and a lawyer, all while being chased by a sad man in a cardigan.

title: Zodiac
bad_explanation: A group of newspaper nerds spend decades trying to solve a crossword puzzle mailed by a very rude pen pal.

title: Full Metal Jacket
bad_explanation: A group of men are taught to love their rifles, hate a building, and then one of them gets very sad about a Mickey Mouse watch.

title: Black Swan
bad_explanation: A perfectionist ballerina gets really into method acting and starts turning into a bird.

title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
bad_explanation: A time-traveling metal man sends his younger self a psychic text message to stop a shapeshifter from ruining the 70s and the future.

title: The Hateful Eight
bad_explanation: A group of untrustworthy strangers in a snowed-in cabin spend three hours arguing about poisoned coffee and who gets to shoot the old man.

title: The Empire Strikes Back
bad_explanation: A man with breathing problems reveals some shocking family news to his son during a very awkward Skype call from the basement.

title: Hidden Figures
bad_explanation: Three brilliant women use their math powers to fight racism and rocket science, all while dealing with a hostile office building that seems to have a bathroom deficiency.

title: Braveheart
bad_explanation: A Scottish man really hates interior decorating and starts a war over some drapes.

title: The Big Lebowski
bad_explanation: A man's rug is ruined, so he gets involved in a convoluted kidnapping plot while bowling and drinking white Russians.

title: Logan
bad_explanation: A grumpy old man with metal allergies has to drive a kid with the same condition to a magical boat while being chased by his own angry clone.

title: V for Vendetta
bad_explanation: A masked man with a flair for the dramatic and a deep hatred for the government tries to win over a young woman by blowing up famous buildings and giving her a room full of butter.

title: A Clockwork Orange
bad_explanation: A young man who loves milk and classical music gets a government-sponsored aversion therapy that makes him sick at the sight of his favorite hobbies.

title: Jurassic Park
bad_explanation: A theme park's IT guy decides to work from home, causing a very hands-on team-building exercise with prehistoric wildlife.

title: Pan's Labyrinth
bad_explanation: A little girl tries to escape her new stepdad's fascist book club by completing three gross chores for a faun who might just be gaslighting her.

title: Amélie
bad_explanation: A shy Parisian woman becomes a supernatural busybody, orchestrating the love lives of strangers while hiding a box of childhood bones and stalking a photo-booth obsessive.

title: Drive
bad_explanation: A stunt driver's life gets complicated when he falls for his neighbor, starts wearing a scorpion jacket, and moonlights as a getaway man who communicates mostly through meaningful stares and sudden, explosive violence.

title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
bad_explanation: A man is born old and gets younger, which makes dating really awkward because he has to keep trading in his partners for newer models.

title: Call Me by Your Name
bad_explanation: A teenager spends a summer learning about ancient statues, fruit, and the art of silently pining for an older houseguest.

title: Life Is Beautiful
bad_explanation: A father convinces his son that being imprisoned in a fascist death camp is just an elaborate, points-based game for a tank.

title: American History X
bad_explanation: A reformed skinhead learns that racism is bad after his little brother starts copying his old homework.

title: Godzilla vs. Kong
bad_explanation: A giant monkey and a giant lizard have a custody battle over a glowing child in the center of the Earth.

title: Trainspotting
bad_explanation: A group of friends in Scotland make a series of terrible life choices, all while arguing over the world's worst bathroom.

title: Memento
bad_explanation: A man with a sticky note addiction tries to solve a mystery he keeps forgetting he's already solving.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
bad_explanation: A charming rebel teaches his new friends to watch baseball and throw a party, but the head nurse really hates fun.

title: Return of the Jedi
bad_explanation: A man in a black onesie has a family reunion in a dangerous forest, then tries to convert his son during a business meeting with an old, wrinkly boss.

title: Donnie Darko
bad_explanation: A troubled teen takes relationship advice from a giant demonic rabbit who convinces him to commit crimes to prevent the universe from ending.
Two soldiers are late for a very important meeting because they keep getting lost in a suspiciously empty battlefield.

title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
bad_explanation: A group of disgruntled office workers stage a massive data breach to email their boss's architectural weakness to the competition.

title: A Beautiful Mind
bad_explanation: A mathematician wins the Nobel Prize for realizing his best friend, his secret government job, and the little girl next door are all just really, really convincing figments of his imagination.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
bad_explanation: A socially awkward teen learns that the secret to high school is befriending seniors who drive around blasting sad songs and giving out free sweaters.

title: Into the Wild
bad_explanation: A privileged college graduate starves to death in an abandoned bus after rejecting maps, money, and edible plants.

title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
bad_explanation: A grieving mother rents three angry signs to publicly shame the local police chief for not solving her daughter's murder, accidentally inspiring a town-wide feud.

title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
bad_explanation: A man and his estranged father race a group of fancy dress enthusiasts across Europe to find a very old, structurally unsound coffee cup.

title: 12 Years a Slave
bad_explanation: A man takes an extended, involuntary internship in the agricultural sector after some bad drinks at a networking event.

title: Million Dollar Baby
bad_explanation: A determined woman learns the hard way that the quickest way to win a championship is to get your neck snapped by a cheap shot in a dirty ring.

title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
bad_explanation: A super-soldier discovers his best friend is now a brainwashed assassin with a cool metal arm, so he fights his entire spy agency to give him a hug and a memory jog.

title: Jojo Rabbit
bad_explanation: A lonely boy's imaginary best friend is a genocidal dictator who disapproves of his crush on a girl hiding in the walls.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
bad_explanation: Two sick kids bond over their shared love of a reclusive author who lives in a house that smells like hamsters and disappointment.

title: Gran Torino
bad_explanation: A grumpy old man with a garage full of racial slurs and a beloved car teaches the neighborhood kids about home defense and the proper use of a finger gun.

title: Slumdog Millionaire
bad_explanation: A man wins a game show by correctly answering questions about the worst days of his life.

title: Requiem for a Dream
bad_explanation: Four people's dreams of fame, fortune, and a perfect figure are derailed by their shared obsession with a refrigerator, a red dress, and a television show that never calls.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
bad_explanation: A rookie cop gets career advice from a foodie cannibal who helps her catch a tailor who wants to make a woman-suit.

title: The Theory of Everything
bad_explanation: A brilliant physicist's marriage falls apart as he slowly becomes a robot, but he still gets to meet the queen.

title: Moana
bad_explanation: A girl returns a stolen rock to a goddess because the ocean is a clingy friend who won't stop giving her gifts.
